main_definition: Matching or equivalent in function, time, position, or quantity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to actions that are similar or match each other at the same time or for the same purpose.
meanings_and_examples.example: The two countries have corresponding ambassadors who work together on various international issues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having an equivalent position, rank, or function in relation to another person or thing.
meanings_and_examples.example: Each participant at the conference was paired with a corresponding counterpart from the other organization.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to something that corresponds in time, such as events happening simultaneously or sequentially.
meanings_and_examples.example: The two trains were scheduled to arrive at their respective stations correspondingly, one after the other.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Matching or equivalent in size, shape, or quantity.
meanings_and_examples.example: She wore a dress that corresponded perfectly with her shoes and handbag in style and color.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Existing at the same time or place as another person or thing.
meanings_and_examples.example: The twins were born correspondingly, one minute apart, into this world.
